snippet.textDisplay: As a fan of this game when I played it, I really need to get to the rest of the series. The unique/horror atmosphere mixed with great writing always made me want to keep going, advancing the story to understand what was going on. This is a very Shinji Hosoe track, who I still think is a vastly underrated composer.
snippet.textOriginal: As a fan of this game when I played it, I really need to get to the rest of the series. The unique/horror atmosphere mixed with great writing always made me want to keep going, advancing the story to understand what was going on. This is a very Shinji Hosoe track, who I still think is a vastly underrated composer.

snippet.textDisplay: @Dr. Velious It's still a great game, but the plot didn't deliver the hype VLR gave it. Still I enjoyed every minute of it, with awesome new characters and twists. But it's still 2>1>3 for me too.
snippet.textOriginal: @Dr. Velious It's still a great game, but the plot didn't deliver the hype VLR gave it. Still I enjoyed every minute of it, with awesome new characters and twists. But it's still 2>1>3 for me too.

snippet.textDisplay: @Dr. Velious It didn't! In the original DS game, you literally had to start the game from the first room every time. You could fast-forward dialog that you've already seen, but that still takes quite a long time and you still need to do all of the escape sequences.
snippet.textOriginal: @Dr. Velious It didn't! In the original DS game, you literally had to start the game from the first room every time. You could fast-forward dialog that you've already seen, but that still takes quite a long time and you still need to do all of the escape sequences.

snippet.textDisplay: @NeatNit I take it that 999 didn't have one originally? in that case I'd completely agree, even in the collection VLRs flowchart was more nuanced than 999s.
snippet.textOriginal: @NeatNit I take it that 999 didn't have one originally? in that case I'd completely agree, even in the collection VLRs flowchart was more nuanced than 999s.

snippet.textDisplay: 999 was the best of the series in my opinion, VLR was ok, but pulled way too many plot points out of its ass to make the story work. I haven't played ZTD but I hear it's kinda bad.
snippet.textOriginal: 999 was the best of the series in my opinion, VLR was ok, but pulled way too many plot points out of its ass to make the story work. I haven't played ZTD but I hear it's kinda bad.

snippet.textDisplay: @Kinda Drake same company, but different teams and composers
snippet.textOriginal: @Kinda Drake same company, but different teams and composers

snippet.textDisplay: @Asdioh Ha, I completely agree with that order! Lots of people prefer the first game, but I liked Virtue's Last Reward much more.
snippet.textOriginal: @Asdioh Ha, I completely agree with that order! Lots of people prefer the first game, but I liked Virtue's Last Reward much more.

snippet.textDisplay: This is one of the best video game series i ever played, the story and plot is so amazing and it connects all three games! Must play titles for me.
snippet.textOriginal: This is one of the best video game series i ever played, the story and plot is so amazing and it connects all three games! Must play titles for me.

snippet.textDisplay: @Kinda Drake I forgot they were by the same company, explains why the music is so great in both
snippet.textOriginal: @Kinda Drake I forgot they were by the same company, explains why the music is so great in both

snippet.textDisplay: How about Danganronpa? It’s by the same people.

snippet.textDisplay: You definitely gotta play the rest, it's an amazing series
snippet.textOriginal: You definitely gotta play the rest, it's an amazing series

snippet.textDisplay: Opinion time SupraDarky: 2 > 1 >> 3, as far as this trilogy goes. Anyway, it's one of my favorite, most memorable series!
snippet.textOriginal: Opinion time SupraDarky: 2 > 1 >> 3, as far as this trilogy goes. Anyway, it's one of my favorite, most memorable series!

snippet.textDisplay: Love you, supra. Thanks for another banger of a track. Sprained my neck today, but this still made me bop my head.

snippet.textDisplay: Kotaro uchikoshi is a great writer at doing intense mystery and pseudo-science like no other,he also is one of the few writers to do ending first then working their way to the beginning of the story.
snippet.textOriginal: Kotaro uchikoshi is a great writer at doing intense mystery and pseudo-science like no other,he also is one of the few writers to do ending first then working their way to the beginning of the story.

snippet.textDisplay: Loving that grimy bass line
snippet.textOriginal: Loving that grimy bass line

snippet.textDisplay: Regarding the story, the first game was great, the second game was phenomenal... and the third game completely shit the bed. Great soundtrack across all three though! And fun puzzles!
snippet.textOriginal: Regarding the story, the first game was great, the second game was phenomenal... and the third game completely shit the bed. Great soundtrack across all three though! And fun puzzles!

snippet.textDisplay: It sucks because uchikoshi didn't write the third game and just only one scenario.

snippet.textDisplay: I played the second game, and while it is fun, it definitely needed a skip cutscenes option. I loved the plot and the puzzles, but it just had too much going from A to B scenes.
